summary: TACE expression was observed in RAM-11-positive areas of atherosclerotic lesions. TACE expression was also expressed in the intimal smooth muscle cells. expression levels of TACE in unstable plaques were significantly higher than in stable plaques. the levels of mRNA and protein expression of TACE in the abdominal aortic plaques were lowered by 53.5%, 70.4% and 65.1% at 1 week, 2 weeks and 8 weeks after lentivirus transfection. however, there was no significant difference in the TACE mRNA or protein expression levels between the control and mock groups. remodeling index and plaque burden were significantly lower in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. however, these imaging parameters did not differ between the control and the mock groups. RAM-11 immunostaining shows the macrophage content in the Control group (A), Mock group (B), and TACE shRNA group (C) at week 16; (D–F) Representative Oil red O staining showing the lipid content in the Control group (D), Mock group (E), and TACE shRNA group (F) at week 16; (G–I) Representative -actin immunostaining showing the content of smooth muscle cells in the Control group (G), Mock group ( gelatin zymography revealed both activities of MMP9 and MMP2 were dramatically down-regulated in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. neovessels were significantly decreased in the TACE shRNA group in comparison with the control and the mock groups. representative immnofluorescence images showing CD31-marked neovessels in the Control group (A), Mock group (B) and TACE shRNA group (C); (D) Quantitative analysis of neovessel number of (A–C); (E–F) Representative western blots showing expression of Flt-1 and VEGF in three groups of rabbits. the serum levels of soluble inflammatory factors including sTNF-, sICAM-1, sVCAM-1 and sMCP-1 were significantly lower in the TACE shRNA group. the relative reduction of sTNF-, sICAM-1, sVCAM-1 and sMCP-1 in the TACE shRNA group was 72%, 26%, 28% and 21%, respectively. correlation analysis showed that the serum concentration of sTNF- was positively correlated with vulnerability index (r2 = 0.6657, P 0.05, Supplementary Fig. 3C) but this correlation coefficient was less than that between TACE activity and vulnerability index. vulnerability index was independently correlated with sTNF-, sICAM-1, sVACM-1 and sMCP-1. the potential signaling pathways involved in the therapeutic effects of TACE gene silencing were summarized in Supplementary Fig. 5. the potential signaling pathways involved in the therapeutic effects of TACE gene silencing were summarized in Supplementary Fig. 5. expression levels of TACE in unstable plaques were significantly higher than in stable plaques (42.6 7.6 vs. 25.2 6.5%, P 0.01) expression levels of TACE in stable plaques were significantly higher than in stable plaques (42.6 7.6 vs. 25.2 6.5%, P 0.01) the TACE protein expression levels in the TACE shRNA group were lowered by 53.5%, 70.4% and 65.1% at 1 week, 2 weeks and 8 weeks after lentivirus transfection. there was no significant difference in the TACE mRNA or protein expression levels between the control and mock groups. relative content of macrophages and lipids in the aortic plaques was significantly lower in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. relative content of SMCs and collagen in the aortic plaques was significantly higher in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. TACE shRNA reduced MMP activities in aortic plaques Western-blot showed that the protein expression level of MMP2 but not MMP9 was substantially lower in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. however, gelatin zymography revealed both activities of MMP9 and MMP2 were dramatically down-regulated in the TACE shRNA group than the control and mock groups. all the gels have been run under the same experimental conditions. black lines indicated the cropped gels and blots. black lines indicated the cropped gels and blots. all the gels have been run under the same experimental conditions. black lines indicated the cropped blots, and full-length blots were presented in Supplementary Fig. 6. serum level of total cholesterol, low density lipoprotein cholesterol, high density lipoprotein cholesterol and body weight did not differ. the serum levels of soluble inflammatory factors including sTNF-, sICAM-1, sVCAM-1 and sMCP-1 were significantly lower in the TACE shRNA group. the relative reduction of sTNF-, sICAM-1, sVCAM-1 and sMCP-1 in the TACE shRNA group was 72%, 26%, 28% and 21% respectively. sTNF- and sICAM-1 ( = 0.363, P 0.001) played major roles in plaque vulnerability. sTNF- and sICAM-1 played major roles in plaque vulnerability. blots show collagen I and collagen III expression in mouse VSMCs. neovessel tube formation in three groups of HUVECs. a fibrous cap thickness less than 100 m has been identified as a marker of unstable plaques19,20. we used this cut-off value to differentiate unstable from stable plaques. aortic plaques correlated significantly with macrophage content and neovessel number in plaques. increased MMP activity in aortic plaques appears to be the most important risk factor of plaque rupture. both MMP9 and MMP2 localized in human vulnerable plaques are capable of active collagenolysis and have been reported to contribute to plaque expansion. ized low-density lipoprotein receptor-1 from macrophages into circulation15. these results suggest that inflammatory factors may activate TACE. release of adhesion molecules by TACE may stimulate adhesive leukocytes to migrate and infiltrate into inflamed tissue. inhibition of local inflammation may be a major contributor to the therapeutic effect of TACE gene silencing in our rabbit model. neovascularization in the adventitia plays an important role in creating a conduit for lipids and inflammatory cells to be transported into plaques to enlarge the necrotic core. endogenous TACE was highly expressed in unstable plaques. mechanisms may involve attenuated macrophage infiltration, inflammatory cytokine expression, neovascularization and neovascularization. mechanisms may involve attenuated macrophage infiltration, inflammatory cytokine expression, neovascularization and vascular positive remodeling. oligonucleotides were annealed and cloned into pGLV1-1 between the HpaI and XhoI sites. the vector was transfected into 293T cells together with the viral packaging vectors. the experiment protocol complied with the Animal Management Rule of the Ministry of Health, People’s Republic of China. intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) study and lentivirus suspension transduction protocol IVUS study was performed at week 8 and 16 by use of a 3.2 F catheter. the image resolution was 150 mm and 300 mm respectively in axial and lateral direction. the IVUS images were reviewed by two independent observers. the averaged values were used for data analyses. animals were administered an overdose of sodium pentobarbital. value of 100m19: stable plaques (>100 m) and unstable plaques (100 m) fibrous caps in adjacent species stained with Sirius red were defined as areas consisting of collagen fibers covering the lipid core. sections were treated with 3% hydrogen peroxide for 10 minutes, blocked with 5% normal BSA at 37 °C for 20 minutes. neovessels were identified as channels surrounded by a layer of endothelial cells highlighted by immunostaining with anti-CD31 antibody. the color was developed with the DAB chromogen and counterstained with hematoxylin. rabbit anti-mouse p-ERK polyclonal antibody (1:1000, Cell Signal), rabbit anti-mouse p-P38 polyclonal antibody (1:1000, Cell Signal), goat anti-human -actin polyclonal antibody (1:1500, Santa Cruz Biotecholog, USA) after each antibody incubation, the blot was washed (three times; 5 min each) with TBS containing 0.1% Tween 20. samples were minced and homogenized in ice-cold 10 mM PBS (pH 7.2) containing 150 mmol/L NaCl, 1% Triton X-100, 0.1% SDS, 0.5% sodium deoxycholate and 0.2% NaN3. each sample was loaded on a 10% SDS-polyacrylamide gel containing 0.1% Tris-HCL, 4%SDS (PH7.2), 16% glycerol, bromo rabbit macrophages culture and siRNA transfection Peripheral blood samples were obtained from all rabbits and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) were isolated by Ficoll density gradient centrifugation and cultured in RPMI 1640 medium with 20% autologous serum at 37 °C in 5% CO2 for 7 days. the macrophages were washed with Opti-MEM and incubated for 2 h with Opti-MEM medium. cell co-cultured VSMCs were seeded at the lower chambers of a 6-well Transwell apparatus with a 0.4 m pore-size polyester membrane. when VSMCs were 50% confluent, RAW 264.7 cells after TACE siRNA transfection were plated into the upper chambers of the Transwell plates. hairpin RNAs were designed to contain 21-nucleotide sense sequences identical to the target molecule(s), followed by a short (7-nucleotide) nonspecific loop sequence and an antisense sequence, followed by two thymidines. the vector was transfected into 293T cells together with the viral packaging vectors by GenePhama, Shanghai, China. rabbits were randomly divided into 3 groups: TACE shRNA group (n = 15, receiving 0.2 mL of 2 109 pfu/mL recombinant Lentivirus-TACE shRNA), mock group (n = 15, receiving 0.2 mL of 2 109 pfu/mL recombinant Lentivirus-scramble shRNA) and control group (n = 15, receiving 0.2 mL of 2 109 pfu/m at week 8, lentivirus and PBS were transfected using an intraplaque injection method. lentivirus suspension or PBS was injected into the corresponding portion of the abdominal aorta with the guidance of IVUS. at week 16, IVUS was repeated. 5m sequential sections were cut from aortic segments embedded in OCT. an average of lipid deposition from nonadjacent 20 separate sections in each aortic ring was calculated. atherosclerotic plaques classified into two groups based on fibrous cap thickness. chemical analysis Serial sections were subjected to immunostaining for RAM11 monoclonal antibody (1:200, Lab Vision Neomarkers, USA), mouse anti-human smooth muscle cell -actin 1A4 monoclonal antibody (1:100, Boster, China), goat anti-human PECAM-1 (CD31) polyclonal antibody (1:100, Santa Cruz Biotechology, USA), goat anti-human iNOS polyclonal antibody (1:200, Santa Cruz Biotecholog, protein was extracted from tissues or cell lystes. equal amounts of protein (30 g/lane) were separated by 10% SDS-PAGE. nonspecific antibody binding was blocked with 5% skim milk in TBS. all blots were probed with - actin as a loading control. densitometric analysis was performed with an image analyzer. mRNA from the abdominal aorta or macrophages of rabbit was prepared with TRIzol Reagent (Invitrogen, USA) and PrimeScriptTM Reverse Transcriptase (Takara Bio Inc, Japan) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. samples were minced and homogenized in ice-cold 10 mM PBS (pH 7.2) containing 150 mmol/L NaCl, 1% Triton X-100, 0.1% SDS, 0.5% sodium deoxycholate and 0.2% NaN3. protein content was measured by a bio-Rad protein assay. mouse macrophages RAW 264.7 and vascular smooth muscle cell lines(VSMC) were cultured in DMEM. human monocyte cell line THP-1 was grown in RPMI1640 medium. human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs, ATCC, USA) were maintained in ECM medium. the plate was incubated at 37 °C overnight to allow gel solidification. the next day, HUVEC (75000/well) were seeded on the matrix gel. the co-cultured cells were seeded on the matrix gel.
